infos.value: This time, I shall explain two matters: <color=#0000ff>changing the point of view</color> in battle, and the <color=#0000ff>Casting Time</color> of magic and other abilities.
Let us first discuss point of view. If you tap the yellow icons at the <color=#0000ff>bottom of the screen</color>, you can view the map <color=#0000ff>from different angles</color>.
Please use this when an enemy is hidden behind a tree or some other obstacle.

If you press the two icons on the <color=#0000ff>bottom left of the screen</color>, you can <color=#0000ff>look over</color> the map in its entirety or <color=#0000ff>look down</color> on the battlefield from overhead.
You can also <color=#0000ff>rotate</color> the map while touching the screen with two fingers. Give it a try later.
The other topic is in regards to Casting Time. Magic and certain abilities require <color=#0000ff>Casting Time</color>.
These actions will not be activated immediately after selection but will instead be performed <color=#0000ff>after a certain amount of time</color>.
You can confirm when the selected action will be activated by examining the <color=#0000ff>Action Timeline</color> on the left of the screen.
In addition, for these abilities, it is necessary to pick <color=#0000ff>Unit</color> or <color=#0000ff>Panel</color> after selecting the action.

If you choose <color=#0000ff>Unit</color>, the selected <color=#0000ff>enemy</color> will be attacked. If you choose <color=#0000ff>Panel</color>, the attack will be applied to the selected <color=#0000ff>area</color>.
In general, it is beneficial to select <color=#0000ff>Unit</color> as the ability will still hit even if the enemy moves during Casting Time.
Selecting <color=#0000ff>Panel</color> is effective in the event that you have predicted enemy routes or gathering areas.
This time, all of the units are <color=#0000ff>mages</color>. Let us effectively make use of the <color=#0000ff>point of view</color> and attack them with <color=#0000ff>magic</color>.
I recommend targeting via <color=#0000ff>Unit</color> so that even if the enemy moves, the attack will still land.
Splendid! You have taken out every enemy.

Though managing Casting Time is difficult, the magic and abilities that require it are quite <color=#0000ff>powerful</color>. If you can master Casting Time, you will be a much more formidable foe on the battlefield.
